The source of the claim: The expert's verdict mentions that the claim was made by Rep. Darrell Issa, R-Calif., who is the incoming chairman of the House Oversight and Government Reform Committee. This aspect verifies the origin of the claim.
Reference to a specific report: The expert's verdict states that the $125 billion figure mentioned by Issa came from an Office of Management and Budget (OMB) report. This aspect verifies the existence of a report that supports the claim.
Scope of the figure: The expert's verdict clarifies that the $125 billion figure mentioned by Issa was not solely for Medicare but included improper payments for various government programs. This aspect verifies the accuracy of the claim in terms of the scope of the figure.
Limitations of the savings: The expert's verdict mentions that not all of the identified improper payments can be returned as savings to taxpayers. This aspect highlights the limitations of the claim and verifies that the entire $125 billion cannot be saved.
